meanings.definition: The state or quality of being idiotic.
meanings.sent1: Her constant idiocies made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help but shake his head at the idiocies of his friend.
meanings.sent3: The idiocies of the clown entertained the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The idiocies of the situation were too much to bear.
meanings.sent5: The idiocies of the character in the movie were unforgettable.

meanings.definition: An act or statement that is foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: The teacher couldn't believe the idiocies some students would say.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her idiocies as soon as she said them.
meanings.sent3: His idiocies always led to hilarious consequences.
meanings.sent4: The idiocies of the past haunted him.
meanings.sent5: The idiocies of the plan were evident to everyone.
